definitions.meaning: 表达不同意或反对某事
definitions.usage: 指对某个提议、计划或观点表示不赞成，通常用于正式或半正式场合，如会议、法律场景或讨论中。

examples.scene: 在公司会议中，团队正在讨论一个新的营销策略。某位员工认为该策略成本过高，决定提出反对意见。
examples.chineseIdea: 员工希望表达对策略的不满，并希望团队重新考虑预算分配。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: During the meeting, she decided to @ @ @ to the proposed marketing strategy due to its high costs.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: During the meeting, she decided to 「raise an objection」 to the proposed marketing strategy due to its high costs.
examples.chineseTranslation: 在会议中，她决定对提议的营销策略「提出反对」，因为成本过高。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：She objected the strategy because it’s too expensive. 纠正：She raised an objection to the strategy because it’s too expensive.（动词‘object’通常接‘to’介词，而‘raise an objection’是更自然的表达。）

examples.scene: 在家庭讨论中，父母计划周末带孩子去游乐园，但大儿子觉得太累，想在家休息。
examples.chineseIdea: 大儿子希望表达自己不想去游乐园，表明自己更愿意选择休息。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: When his parents suggested going to the amusement park, he said he @ @ @ to staying home instead.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: When his parents suggested going to the amusement park, he said he 「had no objection」 to staying home instead.
examples.chineseTranslation: 当父母提议去游乐园时，他说他对留在家里「没有异议」。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：He said he not object to stay home. 纠正：He said he had no objection to staying home.（‘not object’不自然，且‘objection’通常搭配‘have no’来表示同意或无反对。）

definitions.meaning: 法律庭审中对不当问题或证据的反对
definitions.usage: 在法庭上，当律师认为对方的问题、证词或证据不合法或不恰当时，会提出反对，通常伴随特定程序用语。

examples.scene: 在法庭上，辩护律师认为检察官的问题引导性太强，试图影响证人，决定提出反对。
examples.chineseIdea: 律师希望阻止对方律师通过不正当问题影响案件进程。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The defense attorney quickly @ @ @ when the prosecutor asked a leading question.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The defense attorney quickly 「made an objection」 when the prosecutor asked a leading question.
examples.chineseTranslation: 辩护律师在检察官提出引导性问题时迅速「提出反对」。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：The lawyer objected the question. 纠正：The lawyer made an objection to the question.（法律场景中，‘make an objection’是标准表达，而‘object’单独使用不常见。）

examples.scene: 在庭审中，法官认为辩护律师的反对理由不充分，决定驳回反对，继续庭审。
examples.chineseIdea: 法官希望维持庭审的正常进行，驳回不合理的反对意见。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The judge decided to @ @ @, allowing the testimony to continue.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The judge decided to 「overrule an objection」, allowing the testimony to continue.
examples.chineseTranslation: 法官决定「驳回反对」，允许证词继续。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：The judge refused the objection. 纠正：The judge overruled the objection.（‘refuse’不用于法律语境，‘overrule’是法庭术语。）
